TextStructure.definition: A category that groups concepts that mark structure in text

Token.definition: A small unit of text when text is separated on whitespace, punctuation and numerals. Not necessarily carrying much meaning by itself. Not by definition equal to a word.

Word.definition: A fundamental grammatical meaning-carrying item in text structure. Often embedded in a Sentence.

Line.definition: A line in text structure. A line is physically stretches accross one specific spatial dimension (the presentational orientation is not specified nor implied). A line itself by definitions contains no linebreaks/newlines (including leading/trailing newlines). Note that lines may overlap arbitrarily with sentences and words! An optional line marker/number is not part of the line but precedes it.

LineMarker.definition: A marker that precedes a line, for example an explicit line number in the text

Sentence.definition: A grammatically complete syntactic unit, consisting of words.

Paragraph.definition: A self-contained unit of discourse. Leading/trailing whitespace or newlines are not included.

Span.definition: An arbitrary generic grouping of a relatively small amount of text.

Quote.definition: Text representing a quote or citation

Division.definition: An arbitrary generic grouping of a larger amount of text in discourse.

Section.definition: A grouping of a larger amount of text in discourse. This is more specific than 'Division'. Sections often carry numbering, headers, and they can be nested in a hierarchy where sections in sections form subsections, and so on. They may be fully embedded within eachother (nesting), but may not otherwise overlap.

SectionMarker.definition: Number/marker of a section or subsection. Embedded within a section but not within a head

Page.definition: A large span of text on the same unit of a certain physical medium. Pages should not overlap.

PageMarker.definition: A page number or other form of page marker. Should be embedded within a Page.

Letter.definition: A body of text that represents written correspondence/communication between people. Letters should not overlap.

Linebreak.definition: Point at which one line ends and a new line is formed. This annotation is only used in contexts where line breaks are not already implied and should be used sparingly.  The so-called carriage-return is already implied and not encoded separately.

Head.definition: Titles of sections and subsections. If used that way, they are fully embedded within a Section (or Division) and typically the first text in a section, except for the sectionmarker which is not part of the head.

List.definition: A text portion that contains an enumerisation of itemisation of different items, often separated demarked by a bullet, hyphen or numeral.

ListItemMarker.definition: The numeral/bullet/hyphen that marks items in a list. Embedded within a List but not within the ListItem.

ListItem.definition: An item in a list. Does not include the marker (numeral/bullet/hyphen).

Whitespace.definition: Empty parts of the text, i.e. gaps in text, may be either horizontal or vertical.

Figure.definition: A part of the document that contains one or more images, may be accompanied by a caption.

Image.definition: Part of the document where an image is located. Non-textual.

Caption.definition: Text that constitutes the caption for a figure or table. Does not include the number or marker (see FigureMarker).

FigureMarker.definition: Figure number or marker. Should be embedded within a Figure, but not within the caption.

TableMarker.definition: Table number or marker. Should be embedded within a Table, but not within its caption

Row.definition: Text that constitutes a row in a table

Cell.definition: Text that constitutes a single cell in a table

Column.definition: Text that corresponds to a column in a multi-columned layout. Not used in tables.

Note.definition: A footnote, endnote or note in the marginalia.

NoteMarker.definition: A marker/number for a note, footnote, endnote. Should be embedded within the note, usually as first text.

Reference.definition: A reference to another location, either in the text, such as to a footnote/endnote, or an external URI. Use with schema:url.

Entity.definition: A span of text that refers to some kind of named entity

Highlight.definition: A highlighted/emphasised/stylized piece of text, in some presentational form. Use the style property to encode the form.
